I made two versions, one with SC V and one without. I figured out how to add a custom race to the spreadsheet, which made this a lot easier. I still had to manually add the +5 AC and Reflex and the +50 Hide and Move Silently to the text.

If you think that being able to use your take 20 skills like setting or disarming traps during combat just like when not in combat sounds better than getting a +4 AB on attacks of opportunity, then go ahead and take Skill Mastery instead of Opportunist. The only other option would be Slippery Mind, which would do you no good with such a low Will save.

Having SC V on top of Epic Dodge and high AC makes this guy really hard to hit.

posts.content:
Here is a Rog20/Ftr4/WM16 that could easily be morphed into a Rog21/Ftr12/WM7 if you prefer.  I chose halfling for the boosts to AB, AC, stealth and detection but human would give more skill points and another feat.  Pick your poison.   The HP tally was not as bad as I thought it would be, fortunately.

The WM16 has the highest AB but the Ftr12 has a couple more AC iirc.  I could only reach SC 4 with either of these but did it pretty fast and by "hand" so perhaps there is a slightly better fit.  About your comment to use ImpInvis buffed onto an ammy...  obviously this is not a spellcaster, so you'd need to do it via scroll which will produce a grand total of caster level 7, easily dispelled.  SC is permanent so keep that in mind.  It's usually a natural adjunct to any uber DEX build, especially a DW one.

Between ED, SC4, Uncanny Dodge and high stealth, this toon should be relatively safe under most conditions.  Your worst enemies will sport True Seeing and Blind Fight to negate some of your defenses and crit/sneak immunity to spoil your damage... but you can't have everything so it still comes down to planning and strategy.  Know when to hold 'em. Know when to fold 'em.  If traps are effective on your server, that would be a good alternative focus.  If not, skip them altogether.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Dunno about that all-or-nothing reasoning. 

I use Ghostly Visage all the time.  It's only 10% concealment but makes a HUGE difference the moment I start using it.  If this build was meant for PvP, then Blind Fight would counter it pretty well but I'd still rather have the constant concealment in native form, if it's feasible, than the buff.  When you start to encounter wild magic and dead magic zones, you'll begin to appreciate all the intrinsic characteristics over temporary enhancements.  I can't remember the last time I fought any monsters with Blind Fight, perhaps some duergar or drow, but it's not normally a feat proliferated through skins except for boss types.  But Level 40 ImpInvis is about as bullet-proof as you can get and will last almost a full day so I agree that SC's value is borderline even at SC5 with the special item consideration David has at his disposal by virtue of his partymates' skills.

I simply forgot IC, Empyre.  It happens.  That's the price of rushing these builds out.  But perhaps the Rog21/Ftr12/WM7 version is better then.  There are more feats (IIRC you can fit both IC & IKD in that one) at the cost of about 2-3AB (which isn't so bad) while gaining about 2 AC/reflex (I think the final DEX ended up like 38).  As far as the lost 2 pts of damage (probably 6 on crit) from Str14 to Str11... meh.  This toon is depending on sneaks for damage.  EWS will help some but unless a Dexer gets some divine intervention or stacks lotsa FEs, crit immunes usually means it's time to break out the traps.  Dragons can be critted so are not as bad as constructs & elementals even though draconic HP pool is much higher.  A few points of acid or sonic damage on the weapon can make a HUGE difference when you are critting, especially with high multiplier.

Thanks for running the build I posted through the CBC.  I gotta start to add these new races in to take advantage myself.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
My concern was that halflings can't fight dragons on the server I play on.  Not sure if other servers are different

 
Never heard anything like this before, David.  Maybe you mean they can't knock them down or win any discipline check because the dragon race has HUGE discipline.... usually.  Actually, small races have an even greater advantage over their medium allies by virtue of their size.  Halfling fearlessness gives them further luck vs. dragon fear.  But to avoid being KD'd I recommend getting your discipline skill up as high as you can and leave it to the dice to decide your fate.

Dragons can't be sneak-attacked but that goes for any race of rogue.  But they can still be critted (except for dracolichs, which are technically not even dragons)... which is where any WM, halfling or otherwise, has a serious advantage.  Ancient dragons (the standard dragons, not bosses) have an AC around 35-40ish and minor DR so they will get hit alot with any AB over 30.  With a DW AB of +45/+40/+35/+30/+45/+40, your acrobatmaster will be doing constant damage, pretty much hit on every attack.  DevCrit effects (i.e. per STR build) will be relatively ineffective because their Fort save is just too high and their AC just to low to avoid getting hit constantly.  The younger dragons are even easier to deal with. 

Naturally, a +3 or better weapon with some elemental damage that will not be neutralized by their intrinsic immunity will be even more effective.  But that goes for any race, not just those with small stature.

Dragons are really not that imposing for any toon that prepares well, especially with some slashing and piercing DR (Iike archer or swordsman belts).   I recommend using a range weapon to pull one creature at a time away from their pack, though, and then switching back to your main gear when near melee.  IMO, your main problems will be races you can't crit, seeing as how the WM class invests heavily into achieving the maximum efficiency along those lines.

Any toon that has access to traps can make battles with dragons extremely short.  Stack some negatives, pull them through and see what I mean.  Mix some tangle and watch them suffer in slow motion (dragons have horrible reflexes).

edit:  Oooops!  I just noticed that your subrace gives you KD immunity so at least that special attack is no concern.  Called shots and disarm attempts are another matter, though. Seems like the acrobat has enough bonuses to be very effective under a wide range of circumstances.

posts.content: To get Improved Disarm, you must have Disarm, so if you also want Improves Expertise, you would need to lose Toughness as well as KD / IKD. So, yes, you can do that. They both require 13 INT, but you have that.
